letters.description: Establish a compassionate, non-judgmental container to support the emotional and spiritual needs of the dying and their loved ones.
Conduct a holistic evaluation of the individual's physical comfort, environmental setting, and immediate end-of-life requirements.
Facilitate deep listening and storytelling to help the individual process their life journey and document their final legacy wishes.
Serve as a bridge between the family and medical teams to ensure the client’s advanced directives and personal dignity are honored.
Implement non-medical interventions, vigil planning, and sensory adjustments to minimize distress during the active dying phase.
Provide guidance and ritual during the final moments and offer immediate post-death support to help the family begin their grief journey.
